job.title: Operations Manager - LatAm
job.description:
Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.

Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?

As the Operations Manager, you will have the opportunity to help lead the operations in one of the markets in Latin America. You will play a vital role in all aspects of the business, from creating the best possible exchange through best in-field operations, to launching new product offerings in your country. 

This role requires someone who can help the leadership create and drive strategy but also roll up their sleeves and get their hands dirty. You will be expected to help with all areas of the business, from administrative support, hiring, strategic thinking and general problem solving.



Responsibilities:
  • Assist the leadership in leading expansion plans for the market and shape the plan for launching new services while ensuring strong coordination with Government Relations, Marketing and Tech teams along the way.
  • Work with relevant business owners and country General Managers to help them develop new strategies to relentlessly to push operational standards to the next level, shape the business model, and execute accordingly.
  • Work extensively with Data Dashboards to refine User Experience and inform management strategy decisions
  • Helping to coordinate local key marketing activities, such as developing new partnerships and organizing key events.
  • Represent Binance in the local events, media, and in communication with external stakeholders.

    • Requirements:
  • A minimum of 4 years of proven success in a similar role - leading operations/marketing, strong understanding of growth tactics, and a record of high-performing teams.
  • Communication. Being the face of a market means having excellent written and verbal communication skills. You not only need to be inspirational to your team, but also to partners, investors and the public. 
  • Data-focused. Able to roll up your sleeves to pull and analyze the data. You will push the company to be more data-driven in it’s approach for excellence. 
  • Strong interpersonal skills. Able to build and manage strong relationships with their team, cross-functional colleagues, and external partners.
  • Entrepreneurship mentality. Must be a self-starter and leader that assumes the risks and rewards of running an innovative sustainable operation.
  • A passion for crypto and digital assets. We are trying to change an entire industry and it will take time. Passion is what gets you excited to come into work every morning.
    • Working at Binance
    • Do something meaningful; Be a part of the future of finance technology and the no.1 company in the industry
    • Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems
    • International work environment and flat organisation
    • Great career development opportunities in a growing company
    • Possibility for relocation and international transfers mid-career
    • Competitive salary
    • Flexible working hours, Casual work attire

job.title: Technical Customer Support (Part-time)
job.description:
Do you feel passionate about supporting high-performance, multinational teams? Do you thrive in a fast-paced startup environment with new problems to solve every day? Do you want to be part of a young and growing technology organization with a strong vision?

Then come join the Web3 Foundation team in


Customer Support

Web3 Foundation accelerates the development and adoption of the decentralized web. We’re providing the framework and setting the standards for an ecosystem so that the most cutting-edge projects can work together, multiplying their benefit to society as a whole. We’re building the future of identity, privacy, financial markets and commerce through blockchain and cryptographic technologies. At the core of this work is Polkadot - a platform that enables blockchains of all kinds to interact and communicate with one another. This is an opportunity to work at the forefront of technological development and join in shaping the future of society for the better. 


We are a lean team with a flat organisation and are open for remote candidates. You will be working closely together with team members in Zug and in other remote locations, as well as with diverse service suppliers.


Responsibilities

  • Managing user support inquiries, consolidating consistent responses and expediting response times for both Polkadot and Kusama support
  • Working closely with communications, technical education and community teams to customize audience responses and meet stakeholder needs.
  • Resolving technical user issues by identifying the inquiry and selecting the best solution for the users problem; following up to ensure resolution.
  • Building and maintaining the Polkadot and Kusama knowledge bases


Requirements

  • Practical experience of working with the crypto / decentralized technology space, and open source, privacy-minded communities
  • Ability to handle crypto wallets, payments, etc.
  • Familiarity with and strong interest in the Web 3.0 movement, blockchain and other decentralized technologies
  • Technical understanding of decentralized networks and protocols like Polkadot
  • Ability to multitask, prioritize and manage time effectively
  • Excellent communication skills in English (written and spoken) other languages are a plus


A Plus 

  • Computer science or similar background
  • Experience with Freshdesk and/or other similar ticketing systems
  • Willingness and availability to work (some) weekends


Benefits 

  • Competitive compensation and employee benefits
  • Regular company retreats at unique locations located around Europe
  • Work from anywhere in the world (European time zones are preferable)
  • Opportunity to work in a multinational, high-performance  team with diverse backgrounds (i.e. physics, computer science, machine-learning algorithm design, legal, financial products, management consulting, marketing & advertising, etc.)


For more information about us, visit us on:

  • Web3 Foundation website: https://web3.foundation/ 
  • Polkadot website: https://polkadot.network/
  • Github: https://github.com/w3f/polkadot-overview

job.title: Director, UX
job.description:
As a Director of UX, you will help shape the strategy and evolution for Coinsquare’s retail investor applications. This is a multi-faceted role within a company that is starting to scale its people, processes, and product suite. In keeping with this, we’re looking for a leader who has the capability to build a UX discipline that encompasses product design, user research, and analytics informed decision making. Coinsquare is rapidly evolving its suite of products and we expect UX to play a central role in shaping our future strategy. As our Director, UX  you’ll work hand-in-hand with Product Management, so as to elevate the decision making processes around current and future product planning.

What you'll do :
  • Establish and build a fully functional UX department including its processes, practices, and personnel. 
  • Strongly advocate the importance of user-centric decision making and actively promote the merits of a healthy UX discipline.
  • Execute day-to-day UX activities and artifacts such as user flows, journeys, research notes, wireframes, mockups and clickable prototypes.
  • Establish and implement new qualitative and quantitative user research processes in order to make informed, data-driven UX decisions.
  • Mentor and coach an emerging UX department as well as the broader organization on best approaches to UX-based decision making.
  • Collaborate with the team to finalize design decisions for web and mobile applications that meet user, business and technical goals.
  • Foster collaborative relationships with cross functional teams within Coinsquare and with external partners.


    • Experience you'll bring :
  • 7-10 years of experience within the field of user experience with web and mobile based products.
  • Experience building and structuring a UX department that encompasses design, data analytics, user research, usability testing, and prototyping.
  • Willingness and ability to act as a “player/coach” that is comfortable switching gears between strategic planning and day-to-day execution.
  • Experience and ability to communicate, present, and influence at an executive level.
  • An understanding of how UX fits into the Agile/Scrum process.
  • Knowledge and ability to perform competitive landscaping reviews. 
  • Experience shipping live product features from concept to production.
  • Strong sense of visual design, including typography, colour theory, design libraries and grid systems.

    • Coinsquare is Canada’s leading and most secure digital asset trading platform for trading Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin and other digital currencies.

    We built the most secure trading platform, and since our founding in 2014 we’ve never lost a coin. We’re FINTRAC regulated as a money services business, meaning we keep all our clients' money in Canada and use bank-level security measures on our platform.

    We’ve raised over $60M to date, growing from one employee in February 2017 to over 100 employees by January of 2019. We’ve been featured in major media outlets across Canada and are always dedicated to bringing digital asset investing to the mainstream through our various operations like digital currency mining, funds, capital markets, and other offerings coming down the pipeline as we grow.

    Discover what's possible with digital currency by checking out our trading platform:

    Coinsquare for Android | iOS | Web

    We’re full of bright and diverse thinkers. Team members have equal opportunities to contribute to our success within a scale-up culture that encourages self-starters, transparency and team connectivity.

    Coinsquare is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment where we welcome and encourage candidates of all backgrounds to apply. Should you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

    In order to promote and enhance the security of Coinsquare and our platform, just so you know, anyone receiving a job offer will be required to complete a background check.

job.title: Cards Portfolio Manager
job.description:
Description

About Crypto.com

Founded in 2016, Crypto.com today serves over 10 million customers with the world’s fastest growing crypto app, along with the Crypto.com Visa Card — the world’s largest crypto card program — the Crypto.com Exchange and Crypto.com DeFi Wallet. Recently launched, Crypto.com NFT is the premier platform for collecting and trading NFTs, carefully curated from the worlds of art, design, entertainment and sports.

Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have ISO/IEC 27701:2019, CCSS Level 3, ISO27001:2013 and PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level 1 compliance, and independently assessed at Tier 4, the highest level for both NIST Cybersecurity and Privacy Frameworks.

With over 2,600 people in offices across the Americas, Europe and Asia, Crypto.com is accelerating the world’s transition to cryptocurrency. Find out more: https://crypto.com


The Card Portfolio Manager will join our Global Business Solutions team in APAC, working to co-ordinate and track the launch company’s products and accelerating the world's transition to cryptocurrency and facilitating the growth of Crypto.com. He/ she is a key enabler for the operational success of Crypto.com. He/She will lead the Card operations function of Global Business Solutions in Singapore, managing the co-ordination of cross functional projects within the market, and manage the day-to-day operational tasks in APAC.

This role requires the passion to understand complex partnerships, build long-term and collaborative relationships across the organization and negotiate creative solutions to generate significant value for our core products. Candidate must be a self-starter who exhibits strong passion for leading and supporting teams and projects, managing delivery timelines and be responsible for the local business operations.


Responsibilities:

  • Create and be accountable for designing an operational plan and an achievable timeline regarding the delivery of products and solutions into market and develop a schedule for project completion
  • Manage and improve relationships with business partners/ vendors (card schemes, issuers, acquirers etc.) for crypto.com within the market
  • Manage and be responsible for Crypto.com card operations, including card stock management, in-market card compliance management (such as any in market scheme reporting) and assisting Compliance with complaints responses
  • Monitor and track operational performance of business operations
  • Obtain detailed understanding of product, define the scope of the projects in collaboration with the other stakeholders (Compliance, Risk, Business expansion and Product) and help execute enhancements that aim at improving Crypto.com's market penetration, usage and profitability
  • Conduct ongoing oversights with stakeholders that will be affected by the project activities, anticipate possible challenges or problems, evaluate alternatives and find best solution, while constantly reporting on progress of the project
  • Work with compliance and risk team to ensure card and payments products are fully compliant with all local regulatory requirements, including managing necessary reporting
  • Conduct business analysis on current trends, competitors and developments in both the crypto and financial market
  • You will ensure the product(s) are aligned to the business objectives and desired customer experience, and contribute to increasing market share, share of wallet, customer retention, and product & customer profitability.
  • Work closely with internal team to set and/or implement policies, procedures and systems and to follow through with implementation.

Requirements

  • 6+ years of operation management or service delivery experience with banking, payment companies and/or startups/fintechs
  • Must possess product, operations, business analysis or consulting experience with exposure to banking, payment companies and/or start-ups/fintechs
  • Must have prior experience in ITIL incident management processes
  • Card or payment experience preferred
  • Self-starter, hands on and able to work with minimal supervision
  • Experience working in a fast-pace environment, setting your own demanding expectations and work collaboratively and constructively in a team environment
  • Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver results in a highly cross-functional, global organization
  • Strategic thinker, data driven and analytical in approach to solving problems, thinking at ways to improve productivity, efficiency and business outcomes
  • Highly developed communication and presentations skills with a superior ability to effectively communicate and present complex concepts and issues to leadership teams in a highly compelling, persuasive, fact-based manner
  • Excellent skills in communicating ideas both verbally and in written form in a clear, concise, and professional manner.
  • Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of management in an organized and professional manner

Benefits

What can you expect from us?

  • We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech.
  • Flat team. Work side by side with the co-founding team
  • Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. The possibilities are limitless and depend on you
  • You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team

job.title: Head of Financial Planning &Analysis
job.description:
Description

The incumbent of this role will lead CDC’s newly created financial planning and analysis function with the aim to enable the Executive Team and Board to evaluate key decisions and business performance while also delivering ad hoc analysis and insights to maximise the capability of CDC to achieve its strategic goals.

In this role you will…

  • Lead and coordinate the financial forecasting and budgeting processes to support the development of strategic plans and assess CDC’s business performance in pursuit of its strategic goals
  • Design and prepare timely management information for Exec Team and Board, providing high value analysis, commentary and insights to identify opportunities and risks on investments and business performance
  • Support the business performance review process through continuous performance monitoring, providing short and long-term outlooks to support high quality commercial decisions.
  • Develop and enhance performance monitoring systems and reporting tools to ensure consistency approach on the analysis of operational performances across different markets and functional/product groups
  • Influence others on the prioritization of strategies and tactics by providing a financial perspective and relevant financial information to assist with the decision-making process.
  • Provide leadership, guidance, and hands on management to the Financial Planning and Analysis team to foster collaboration within team and across departments to achieve maximum performance

Requirements

  • 10+ years of progressive financial management experience in geographically distributed organisation
  • Demonstrated experience of FP&A decision support success within a fast-growing and dynamic organisation
  • Demonstrated capabilities in driving a financial agenda by focusing on the major strategic issues facing the organisation as it moves forward
  • Strong financial modelling experience to handle urgent requests and changing priorities
  • Demonstrated ability to translate strong technical capabilities into sound commercial judgement.
  • Extremely detail oriented with an ability to multitask in a high growth environment
  • Passionate about start-ups and the growth of digital assets
  • Excellent command of spoken and written English

Benefits

job.title: Social Media Wizard
job.description:
Our mission is to bring blockchain to a billion people. The Alchemy Platform is a world class developer platform designed to make building on the blockchain easy. We've built leading infrastructure in the space, powering over $45 billion in transactions for tens of millions of users in 99% of countries worldwide.

The Alchemy team draws from decades of deep expertise in massively scalable infrastructure, AI, and blockchain from leadership roles at leading companies and universities like Google, Microsoft, Facebook, Stanford, and MIT.

Alchemy recently raised a Series C led by a16z at a $3.5B valuation, having previously raised from Coatue, Addition, Stanford University, Coinbase, the Chairman of Google, Charles Schwab, and the founders and executives of leading organizations.

Alchemy powers the top blockchain companies globally and has been featured in TechCrunch, Forbes, Bloomberg, and elsewhere. 

The Opportunity

Alchemy is hiring its first social media leader. A true social native, a Twitter genius. Someone who will make the rest of us feel out of touch thanks to their meme fluency, who knows how to engage in the right conversations in the right way. Alchemy is at the heart of Web3 development, and we need to be at the heart of Web3 conversation. You'll guide us on the strategy, helping us leverage social, especially Twitter, to grow our business and build our community. We'll look to you to help us differentiate between what should be text, video, image, or live conversation. And you'll need to execute. We're a small but wildly successful company, and we all get our hands dirty.

Responsibilities
  • Develop a clear social strategy that is tied to business objectives with measurable outcomes
  • Develop and maintain a social media based community for Alchemy
  • Work cross functionally to leverage social as a critical tool in marketing Alchemy's products and services
  • Build Alchemy's presence, and the presence of our leadership, as consistent participants in relevant conversations about Web3, blockchain, NFTs etc.
  • Define Alchemy's social voice and generate creative ideas to differentiate our presence in social

    • What We're Looking For
  • 3+ years leading social for a dynamic tech-focused company
  • 5+ years relevant marketing, social, and/or communications experience
  • Ideally, experience in social for a software, SaaS, or developer platform company with a non-consumer focus
  • Experience developing and leading successful social campaigns for product launches and thought leadership campaigns
  • Experience developing and managing social strategies that include the corporate social presence in addition to key executive social profiles
  • A proven track record of utilizing social to support and broaden the impact of other marketing and communications efforts (e.g. event participation)
  • The ability to leverage data to direct social strategy and refine plans
  • Exceptional writing skills

Institutional Account Executive
job.description:
FTX US is a US-regulated cryptocurrency exchange, built from the ground up. Its mission is for FTX US to grow the digital currency ecosystem, to offer US and international traders a platform that inspires their loyalty, and to become the market leading US regulated cryptocurrency exchange by volume within the next two years. We are looking for talented individuals to join our fast paced team to help us on this mission!  

FTX US is looking for a detail oriented, organized self-starter who is meticulous with operational activities to join our Business Development team. As an Institutional Account Executive, you will be accountable for sales and account management of our VIP and institutional accounts. You will own the relationships from initial outreach and signing, through facilitating KYC and onboarding, testing and integrations, account and project management to align internal resources to customer needs and into ongoing maintenance and support.

We are looking for someone to have a deep product understanding to act as a quarterback of internal resources. This is a person who has a passion for sales, a strong understanding of our products and the exchange business, and the ability to build strong relationships.

What we're looking for:
  • Highly motivated sales professionals with 3+ years of experience driving results
  • A team player, someone who can interact with multiple members of our team and work incredibly well under pressure
  • Highly efficient, with the ability to manage multiple projects
  • Ideal candidates will have a strong network in the crypto industry and 2+ years in BD roles
  • Experience in crypto is highly preferred but not required, and experience in financial services is a plus. 
  • Strong preference for candidates in the Bay Area or Miami
    • FTX US is an equal opportunity employer.

job.title: Senior Account Executive - Standard Custody
Director of Compliance (Internal Controls & Governance)
Implementation Consultant
job.description:
As an implementation Consultant, you will leverage your project management skills, knowledge of enterprise systems (e.g. Model N, SAP, Vistex, Microsoft Dynamics, etc) and processes to manage the implementation and integration of Chronicled’s products into our customers’ enterprise environments. Through customer engagements you will gain an understanding of the business requirements and translate that in various forms, such as (e.g. flow charts, architecture diagrams, business requirements documentation, etc.)  You will partner closely with technical resources to synthesize your findings into a holistic technical solution and implementation plan and will manage the execution of that plan while keeping stakeholders well informed of your progress.

Chronicled has established the decentralized MediLedger Network, which connects the pharmaceutical industry and runs mission critical processes. You will be working on the software that connects to and runs the Network. You will be building a cutting-edge platform using the latest technological achievements at the intersection of blockchain, cryptography, distributed computing and network protocols.

We're building real blockchain solutions that solve real problems. Come join us!


What you'll do:
  • Consult and develop relationships with Chronicled’s Enterprise customers to understand their current state and the critical business objectives driving the implementation of our solution
  • Elicit and document business and technical requirements. 
  • Analyze current processes and work with business stakeholders to define “To Be” (future state) processes.
  • Develop project plans, roadmaps, customer implementation plans, UAT plans, etc. to drive the successful implementation of Chronicled’s solutions in order to achieve the customer’s desired business outcomes
  • Install and configure Chronicled’s solutions within our customers’ networks and triage any technical issues that may arise during this process
  • Track and drive the resolution of implementation issues, engaging other Chronicled teams as needed (e.g. QA, Engineering, Product, etc.)
  • Track implementation delivery across multiple, in-flight projects; create regular project status reports and publish reports to relevant stakeholders
  • Work with the Quality Assurance team to develop testing strategies, drive customer testing, and deploy changes within our customer’s multi-tiered, enterprise environments
  • Contribute to the development of end user documentation related to implementation-related business process or system changes and provide training as needed to support end users through business process or system change.
  • Receive, document and analyze customer feedback about the products and implementation process to identify opportunities for improvementIdentify opportunities to streamline and/or optimize solution delivery and recommend/take actions to capitalize on those opportunities

    • What you'll need:
  • Experience implementing and/or integrating with industry leading enterprise software applications like Model N, SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, Vistex, etc.
  • Specific experience with Revenue Management processes and applications preferred
  • Experience with Life Sciences industry business processes and applications preferred
  • Experience with end to end application development and support tasks, working closely with both functional and technical resources. 
  • Experience gained from performing a functional role such as business analyst and a technical role such as technical analyst/system analyst is highly preferred.
  • Ability to analyze and document complex business processes
  • High level of proficiency utilizing development, data, and business process analysis tools and techniques (SDLC, Business Process models, data maps, sequence diagramming).
  • Experience applying the principles of business and/or systems analysis to small, mid-size or large complex business problems using standard project related tools and techniques.
  • Working knowledge of Project Management Tools (Confluence, JIRA, Microsoft Project, SmartSheets, etc.) and standard SQA Tools.
  • Strong facilitation skills to elicit requirements from varying personalities across organizations including senior executives and technical resources
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills to communicate effectively with clients, team members, and managementExcellent interpersonal and client management skills as well as a positive attitude
  • Must be able to manage multiple competing priorities with an ability to shift focus quickly without distraction
  • Must be able to manage conflict and work well under pressureMust be technically literate and capable of communicating complex, technical concepts in language appropriate for technical and non-technical audiences alike.
  • Bachelor’s degree in information systems, computer science, business administration, or a related field, or equivalent relevant work experience
  • Preferred Licenses/Certifications: Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification, PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA) or IIBA Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)
  • Proficiency with at least one modern enterprise programming language such as Java, .Net, or JavaScript is highly preferred
    • At Chronicled we take pride in our Total Rewards Package which is available to all full time Chronicled Employees:

    Full benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision. 401k, 529 College Saving Plan, Gym Membership, Commuter Benefits, Employee Perks Program Equipment: Macbook pro and accessories standard issue. As well as a modern fully stocked office space with many amenities
    Location: Centrally located and easily accessible offices in San Francisco and remote employees globally!
    Flexibility: We believe flexibility comes in multiple forms. Freedom to express yourself with an open startup casual dress code, Flexible schedules. Best of all we have an unlimited vacation policy that allows you to get the rest and relaxation you need to refresh.
    Welcoming Culture: We call ourselves a family for a reason. We foster a fun and creative atmosphere where anyone can openly contribute ideas, feel appreciated, and feel empowered to be who they are. Fun is also highly encouraged! Frequent offsite team building events and weekly happy
    Recognition: Respect and prominence due to work contributions, working on cutting edge technology. Our employees are celebrated and recognized for their contributions
    Variety: Opportunities to experience different job tasks, change responsibilities, and project opportunities
    Workload: Challenging and fast paced work. There is never a dull moment in our Enterprise Blockchain Laboratory. Work Importance: The typical Chronicled team member has a bias for action. We do. We build. We step outside of the scope. We believe we will change the world. Control your own Destiny: Ability to influence others and control one’s own destiny.

job.title: Lead Data Engineer
job.description:
Description

As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.

The company has offices in London, UK, New York City, Singapore and Tokyo. We are backed by Evolution Equity Partners, SoftBank, SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group.

To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.

What’s the role?

Elliptic is looking for a Lead Data Engineer to join our product-engineering organisation who can help drive forward our support for new blockchains.

We want an engineer who will work collaboratively with the data science team to create and support a data lake that will improve our understanding of new blockchains and bring additional asset support to our market leading compliance products. There are thousands of potential blockchains we could add support for, with varying levels of functional complexity, a vast array of features and extensive data sets, so your role will be to help build a simplified and agnostic solution.

We are looking for somebody who always tackles the biggest risk first, who brings new ideas and approaches to development, who makes decisions with data, and who loves solving customer-centric problems.

What will you do?

  • Take pleasure from clean code and see writing tests as core to software engineering
  • Use data to make decisions about what to build and how to iterate
  • Measure their successes with usage data rather than release milestones
  • Are not afraid to fail, experiment often and learn quickly
  • Are keen to learn new technologies and challenge existing tools, methodologies, processes
  • Ship code to production every day

In a typical week you will:

  • Work in a fast, lean, Agile environment with minimal process overheads
  • Develop new batch or streaming features of our data pipeline
  • Review the code of your peers, and test that it works
  • Participate in various “chapter” debates about new ideas and interesting tech
  • Support your software on production

Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience in Apache Spark or any other big data processing tool
  • Experience leading a team of 3+ engineers in a production environment
  • Design, build, test and debug batch and streaming data pipelines capable of processing large volumes of data.
  • Experience performance tuning queries and data models to produce the best execution plan
  • Experience with Data Lake implementations and design patterns
  • A strong understanding of the Big Data ecosystem
  • A strong coding background in either Scala or Java
  • Someone with the desire to learn and code in Scala

Bonus Points for:

  • Experience of leading personal development plans for your team e.g. 1-to-1's, performance reviews, etc.
  • Experience in other Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Presto, Kafka, Hive, Flink, Delta, Hudi, etc..)
  • Experience with AWS Big Data tools such as Kinesis, Glue, Athena and EMR
  • Has experience working with Data Science teams
  • Confident working with SQL
  • HODLs some crypto

Benefits

  • Share Options
  • Holiday - 25 days + public holidays + additional day for your birthday
  • Private Health Insurance - we use Vitality!
  • Work Pension Scheme
  • Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite
  • $1000 Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription
  • £500 Home office allowance
  • Enhanced parental leave; we provide eligible employees, regardless of gender or whether they become a parent by birth or adoption, 16 weeks fully-paid leave and job-protected leave
  • Full access to Spill Mental Health Support
  • Our offices provide all of the amenities you could need
  • Work with top of the range equipment - MacBook Pro and any other equipment you need

We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.
